wikipedia_page.main: Dorothea Hosie born Dorothea Soothill aka  Dorothea, Lady Hosie (1885 – 15 February 1959) was a British amateur film maker and writer on China. She assisted her father and her husband, Alexander Hosie, with their writing but when they died she published books on her own account. During the World War II she was vice-principal of an evacuated private school in Somerset.
